title: Aflatoun Academy (EN)
description: Aflatoun International offers social and financial education to millions of children and young people worldwide, empowering them to make a positive change for a more equitable world.

children.title: Origins of Aflatoun
children.description: As a teacher in the Aflatoun programme you should know something of its origins. You will remember that the subject was covered on the first day of the teacher-training workshop you attended. By taking this module we hope your memory is refreshed

children.title: Interview with Lata Narayan on the founding of Aflatoun
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Clubs in the Aflatoun Programme
children.description: Aflatoun Clubs play a central role in the bigger Aflatoun Programme. At the teacher-training workshop you attended these would have been discussed briefly on the first day. By taking this module, we hope you find out more about the role of these clubs and how you can go about setting one up.

children.title: Clubs and Elections Around the World
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Core Programme Activities
children.description: It  is  important  to  make  sure  your  school  is  conducting  a  variety  of  different activities  as  part  of  its Aflatoun programme. In fact, we recommend that you include seven different sorts of activities to get the right balance. You have probably already looked at these briefly on the first day of your Aflatoun teacher-training  workshop.  By  taking  this  module  we  hope  that  you  refresh  your  memory, and  get some ideas about the sorts of exciting activities you could be doing with the children you teach.

children.title: How to Play the Core Programme Activities Game
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: CRC and Quality of Education
children.description: The United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child gives us teachers some marvellous advice on the sortof education we must provide to children. The emphasis here is on qualityof education. We hope that you find this module inspiring and that in helps you develop your own classroom teaching style.

children.title: The United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC)
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: What the UNCRC defines as good education for children
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Gender Equality in the Classroom
children.description: Usually  on  Day  Two  of  an  Aflatoun teacher-training workshop there’s a session dedicated to the question of ensuring gender equality in the classroom. One short session isn’t long when you consider how serious the problem is. We hope that you enjoy this module, that it helps refresh your memory and maybe inspires you with some new ideas.

children.title: The interview with Stacey Dixson of FHI360
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Children and Saving
children.description: Clearly saving is a big part of any Aflatoun teacher-training workshop. What do you remember of the session on saving? We hope that you enjoy this module, that it helps refresh your memory and maybe inspires you with some new ideas.

children.title: Children Savings System Around the World
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Child Social and Financial Enterprise
children.description: Helping children to design and deliver their own little social and/or financial enterprises is one of the most distinctive aspects of the Aflatoun programme. On the last day of your Aflatoun teacher-training workshop you probably worked with a group of other teachers to design an imaginary enterprise. Do you remember that?We hope that you enjoy this module, that it helps refresh your memory, provides you will a fuller understanding of the sorts of enterprise projects children do around the world, and maybe inspires you with some new ideas.

children.title: Child Social and Financial Enterprise: Case Studies
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Child Social and Financial Enterprise Checklist
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Story on Social and Financial Enterprises
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Teacher Talking Time versus Student Talking Time
children.description: The biggest focus of any Aflatoun teacher-training workshop is naturally on practice teaching. Perhaps you remember these sessions? Teachers are given lesson plans from the Aflatoun books and asked to present a mock lesson. The other participants then critique their performance using a set list of questions. One ofthe aims of those micro-teaching  sessions is to help teachers use a variety of teaching methods, beyond simply lecturing. In this module we look more closely at one aspect of classroom teaching i.e. the ratio of Teacher Talking Time versus Student Talking Time as this is very often a reliable way of measuring  the  extent  to  which students are  actively engaged  in  their  own learning. We hope that you enjoy this module, that it helps refresh your memory, provides you with a fuller  understanding of this  aspect of active-learning  and maybe  even inspires you with some  new ideas.

children.title: Teacher Talking Time versus Student Talking Time
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Animation about Teacher Talking Time versus Student Talking Time
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Brainstorming
children.description: In an Aflatoun teacher-training workshop  we normally  look at Brainstorming on the first day. Brainstorming is a very simple method on the face of it, and yet many of us teachers can find it a little bit challenging at first because it requires us to do many things that we might not be used to e.g. letting children talk in an unregulated way, not correcting their answers initially etc. We hope that you enjoy this module, that it helps refresh your memory, provides you with a fuller understanding of this aspect of active-learning and maybe even inspires you with some new ideas.

children.title: Interview with April Coetzee of Warchild Holland
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Problem Tree
children.description: A Problem Tree is a wonderful active-learning method, helping children to look at a problem or issue in terms of cause and effect. Problem Trees feature in many of the Aflatoun books. Do you remember a session on Problem Trees at your Aflatoun teacher-training workshop? We hope that you enjoy this module, that it helps refresh your memory, provides you with a fuller understanding of this aspect of active-learning and maybe even inspires you with some new ideas.

children.title: Image Theatre
children.description: Image Theatre offers children a creative and playful active-learning method. Do you remember doing a session on Image Theatre at an Aflatoun teacher-training workshop? We hope that you enjoy this module, that it helps you refresh your memory, provides you with a fuller understanding of this aspect of active-learning and maybe even inspires you with some new ideas.

children.title: KWL  Charts
children.description: KWL  Charts  provide a structure to your lesson and encourage the direct participation of children through brainstorming. We are sure you remember them from the Aflatoun teacher-training workshop. We hope that you enjoy this module, that it helps refresh your memory, provides you with a fuller understanding of this active-learning method and maybe even inspires you with some new ideas.

children.title: Memory Cards
children.description: You may remember playing this card game at an Aflatoun teacher-training workshop as part of an exercise on Rights and Responsibilities. We hope that you enjoy this module, that it helps refresh your memory, provides you with a fuller understanding of this active-learning method and maybe even inspires you with some new ideas.

children.title: Making Your Own Memory Card Games
children.author: Aflatoun

children.title: Group Work
children.description: At some of the longer Aflatoun teacher-training workshops we do a session on group work in general, and the jigsaw method in particular. If you have participated in one of those sessions this module should help you recall ideas you might have forgotten. If you haven’t been on one of those sessions, we hope this module might stimulate your curiosity about group work and maybe even inspire you with some ideas.

children.title: Training Manual
children.author: Aflatoun
children.description: The Training Manual seeks to familiarize the reader not only with the core themes of Aflatoun's educational materials, but also with Aflatoun's preferred child-centered pedagogical approach.
